He saw their replies and their commlinks open on his single secured
send-on=
ly frequency. He half-smiled for a moment, then came back to
reality. This =
had to go smoothly. He started to speak.

Jotunn: My loyal Iron Skull fello=
ws, I thank you for being so many to
hear me out today. While the reason of=
 my speech to you may be a
thundering shock to some of you, I expect noneth=
eless strict adherence
to my orders and the uttermost compliance from your =
part.

He let a few nanoclicks pass before going on.

Jotunn: You all know =
that the Minion have done us terrible wrongs in
the past. They have wrecked=
 our power stations, our training
facilities, and sometimes even our homes.=
 They have killed our peers
and our families. And the worst thing is that w=
e have not been able to
thwart their efforts effectively. They could attack=
 anytime now, and
would not meet with more resistance than before. What I s=
ay to you, my
followers, is that we Predacons have been held back from bein=
g useful.

Another Pause. This part would be tricky.

Jotunn: Yes, the gove=
rnmental Army has failed defending us properly
because it has not acknowled=
ged what we know is true, that we must
meet the Unicronians with all the mi=
ght we have in our hands, and all
the weapons we can carry. We must destroy=
 them. The way it turns out,
however, is that we were not alone in taking t=
he decisions. The
Bushidos avoid to side themselves with us from fear of ec=
onomic
reprisals. The Silver Wings, in their oh-so-great pride, think we wa=
nt
to slay them to the last the way our ancestors did. The Pacificus
shake =
at the idea of holding a gun. And the Watchers, well, they are
as they alwa=
ys have been. I say that this must change.

Good, almost done.

Jotunn: Her=
e are my orders. As of now, the Iron Skulls become the
ruling members of Go=
vernment with me as their leader. The other
factions are not to be harmed u=
nless they attack first. Avoid all
gunfight, brawl, or battle that are avoi=
dable. Now I know that some of
them will not understand and still fight us.=
 You have all the rights
to defends yourselves. I want as few casualities o=
n their side as
possible. Take prisoners instead. To the soldiers in the ar=
my, I want
you to lock up any unit not loyal to me. While Bushidos and Watc=
hers
are to be negotiated with to take on our side, Maximals are not to be
=
given that opportunity. Once that is done, secure the Parliament in
Relay a=
nd defend it from any opposition. To anyone else, offer the
Loyalist Army a=
ll the support you can. Remember, though: this is not a
civil war, it is a =
way for us to defend everyone better from the
Minions, especially if that i=
s done against their will. Iron Skulls,
you have your orders. Execute them =
fast and well. Predacons Forever!

He cut the line, and slooped. He wondere=
d, once again, if that was how
the war between the Autobots and the Decepti=
cons had started. He
wished he had learned his history better, but slavery =
had not allowed
him to. Right now though, he hoped the Minions wouldn't att=
ack until
he was finished.
